ygData.subject: Re: Fear and level 16 spell questions.
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Generally speaking your pet will attract things that wouldn t touch you but in the case of running or fighting mobs, all mobs call for help as they fight
ygData.messageBody:
At 12:15 PM 6/28/99 -0400, you wrote:
>From: Scott Murawski <scott@...>
>
>I just started using fear yesterday just for the heck of it.
>I'm always fighting stuff that trains and so I'm paranoid that I'll cause a
>huge train while romping around
>the area stabbing the fleeing mob in the back.
>
>So the question is
>Suppose I fear a wisp and I have a pet. If I just stand where I am and not
>follow, will my pet following the wisp cause a train if wisps are in the area?
>


Generally speaking your pet will attract things that wouldn't touch you but
in the case of running or fighting mobs, all mobs call for help as they
fight so if another mob is nearby it will respond. In other words if there
are other wisops close enough they will jump in regardless.



>Also, since I'm getting close to level 16, I might as well start pouring on
>the questions
>
>Does levitate last long?
>

Long enough, 10 mins maybe. There is a slight bug with levitate thouhg where
sometimes people and other things like mobs not beign on the same z axis as
you become invisible. Happens randomly.

>I've heard that quickness doesn't last long and I notice that it has a high
>mana requirement. What level is it
>mana efficient to use at? (eq similar to chaotic feedback, at lv 8, it
>isn't so mana efficient)

If your partied with a Monk always use it. If you are drawing a CONTINOUS
string of blues then it usually lasts 2 fights. I always wait two levels
before really using a new spell because at that point the fizzle rate and
mana efficiency are better.

>
>I think I've seen it before, but I can't remember. Rune I uses a component
>right? What is it?
>
>Thanks
>

Cats eye agate, 2.8 gold or thereabouts. You will probably not be casting
this spell to often. It only protects from meleee and it costs to much for
regular use.
